intro: Xanthosia tomentosa, commonly known as the woolly xanthosia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae and is characterized by its dense, woolly foliage that gives it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in spring, adding a subtle ornamental value. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and sandy environments. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
